intro: Roldana scandens, commonly known as the climbing roldana, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its slender, twining stems. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often used in traditional medicine. Roldana scandens thrives in cool, humid climates and is often found growing along forest edges or in rocky areas.
